title: I GOT PERMA BANNED FOR REPEATING WHAT SOMEONE SAID
body:
first things first, i want to clarify that i have not gotten an email concerning my ban like riot has said they would send. i was supposed to get an email regarding it, but have yet to receive one.  

so my name is Blazed Nami, i've only ever been chat banned 3 time in league, and banned once for 3 days years ago for leaving games due to parental problems. today I was playing a normal, and i had gone bot lane as support, and once i had flashed my mastery 7 icon the enemy support had called me sad for having mastery 7 on annie. now she was clearly trying to start something, and i hadnt had said anything alone the lines of being banned or getting a chat ban. as the game goes on, leo and i still talk, and our yasuo had commented and said to report me, and when he had said to report me, he had said, "report this dumb N annie" and all i had said after that was repeating what he had said so that the enemy team could report him. now i never called ANYONE a dumb N or anything along the lines of that.

 i have been playing league of legends **for almost 5 years now, and have spent over $2k on this game.** i got a **PERMA BAN**, for something i didnt do wrong. should i be banned? why not give me a 2 week suspension? why not ban me from the chat permanently? ANYTHING would be better than a PERMA ban on a game that i play day and night. riot why? i honestly dont thin a perma ban is needed for this, especially when the yasuo, who had originally said that comment, didnt even get a chat restriction or anything.. 

yes i have said wrong things, but im not a toxic player. when people say things to me, i get worked up yes and i can admit that, but please remove the perma ban and at least make it a suspension. chat ban me, something other than perma ban. riot i have made mistakes and wish to please have my account back. this isnt fair honestly, nothing even happened to the guy that had said it to me, also, leona had been trying to claim i was a female by saying i complained like one. im not the only one in the wrong yet i was the only one punished.

here's my chat log:

Blazed Nami: are you 12?
Blazed Nami: u mad yas?
Blazed Nami: isnt it past your bed time kid
Blazed Nami: keep feeding yas
Blazed Nami: gg

whether i have to /mute all everygame and never speak to a single soul in chat, or whether i have to write a 10,000 letter report on why i should get my account back, ill do anything to have it back. league is love league is life, and this is honestly just devastating.

why do people constantly believe posters like this? At this point doubting should be your first and only reaction. Sure show support if they are waiting on a ticket reply after 4 ish days. 

How many times do people need to burned before they learn?

Usually being doubtful is my first approach (doesn't mean I wouldn't support them in their endeavour to clear things up, though).
It's just that this case was different than most others, simply because OP had a plausible story that could explain why he was hit by a false positive. Most people just try to make that seem plausible by being overly surprised or outraged about their punishment, or maybe tell people an irrelevant sob story.

Honestly, these forums made me extremely cynical, but I have to admit that it has been a while since I've seen a case where somebody was lying and manipulating their chatlog this blatantly. Most people just lie implicitely or by omission in hope that the truth doesn't come out. OP couldn't possibly have hoped for any other outcome than to get smited, so I'm genuinely surprised they even tried that tactic.

I have only seen 1 cases of false positives for behavior,  when the person was trash talking him self and the system did not understand it. In this case they were even warned to do that since theoretically they are being detrimental to the environment of the game. All other cases have been held up or held up but decided that the penalty was a tad harsh(instant perma). Toning down of a punishment is not saying exonerated. 

The only cases i can remember that have been turned around are either hacked stories where there was previous documentation, false positive on 3rd party, or account sharing . And neither of those are behavioral in nature.

give this i will never believe these cases. People need to start applying reasonable doubt in things like this. 

IS it reasonable to modify there logs?
IS it reasonable to think they would lie? 
are they a stranger and you have no basis to trust there word.

if yes to all 3, then it is safer to doubt. You can bump for viability but do not get on the band wagon of how they were wronged.
i have seen people get exonerated and have their accounts reinstated after getting banned
the amount exonerated is what .01% that is way beyond a case of reasonable dobut
